snippet: The three young men, accused of violating a French antiterrorism law, were caught in 2012 as they tried to fly to Turkey and eventually join the Syrian rebellion.
abstract: First trial of French citizens accused of trying to join rebellion in Syria concludes; judge says he will render a verdict and sentence Youssef Ettaoujar, Fares Farsi and Salah-Eddine Gourmat in March 2014.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and MAÏA de la BAUME

lead_paragraph: The three young men, accused of violating a French antiterrorism law, were caught in 2012 as they tried to fly to Turkey and eventually join the Syrian rebellion.

headline.main: Verdict in March for 3 in France Accused of Intent to Fight in Syria
headline.print_headline: Verdict in March for 3 in France Accused of Intent to Fight in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
